Authors:
Adebola Azeez Lateef, Sepiah Muid, Mohamad Hasnul
Bolhassan
Title:
Description of Pseudopestalotiopsis sepiahiana sp. nov., a
new species of microfungi from Kubah National Park, Sarawak,
Malaysia.
Keywords:
Keywords: ITS, Pestalotiopsis, Pseudopestalotiopsis, new
species, microfungi.
Abstract:
Abstract A survey on the diversity and distribution of
microfungi was carried out, during which a distinct Pestalotiopsis
species was isolated from green leaves of Macaranga sp. from Kubah
National Park, Sarawak. This species is clearly distinct from other
Pestalotiopsis sp. by its long apical appendages, cylindrical and bigger
conidia and dark brown concolourous median cells. The phylogenetic
analysis of DNA sequences from the internal transcribed spacer gene
region (ITS1, 5.8S and ITS2) of the rDNA shows this species to form a
distinct clade from the Pestalotiopsis sp., and cluster with the genus
Pseudopestalotiopsis, a new genus which was recently carved out from the
genus Pestalotiopsis. This species also differs clearly from all
presently known Pseudopestalotiopsis species such as Ps. theae, Ps.
indica, and Ps. cocos, by its darker concolourous median cells, conidial
shape and size. The new microfungal species, Pseudopestalotiopsis
sepiahiana is hereby described based on morphological and molecular data
as the fourth species in the genus Pseudopestalotiopsis.
